<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>In just a few hours, Morning Brew will be hosting a star-studded charity poker tournament, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/chipping-in" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Chipping in for COVID</a>. The response has been crazy: Together, we've raised more than $130,000 for nonprofit Frontline Foods. Registration closes at 12pm ET today, so...in a few hours for most of you.</p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

</li>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Now, onto the <em>other </em>main event:</strong> business news. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/big-tech-flexes-muscles-pandemic-antitrust-probes-await?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Tech: In the Right Place at the Right Time
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Big Tech as Ghostbusters" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MDEvYmlnX3RlY2hfYXNfZ2hvc3RidXN0ZXJzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It used to be a joke: “Big Tech runs my life.” Now, in the middle of a global pandemic, we can say it without any hint of irony. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nightclubs, gyms, and, well, far too many things have migrated to <strong style="color:#000">Facebook’s</strong> Instagram Live.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Amazon</strong> delivers our essential goods, and...some nonessential goods <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/zipper-mouth-face_1f910.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">. While more than 30 million Americans have filed for unemployment since March, Amazon hired 175,000 new workers—more jobs than it added all of last year.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Q1 earnings are <a href="https://www.axios.com/microsoft-earnings-stock-market-coronavirus-e5e19508-9b34-44a9-9a4a-12d1c3ac606b.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set to fall</a> by 15.8% (the most in more than a decade), but <strong style="color:#000">Microsoft </strong>said the coronavirus had “minimal net impact” on its revenue. That marked the first time in history that "coronavirus" and “minimal impact” were used in the same sentence. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Screen time on <strong style="color:#000">Apple’s</strong> phones used to indicate isolation and loneliness—now it measures whether we’ve been interacting with people. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Google</strong> was supposed to be dinged by lower ad spend across the board, but...even that <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-revenues-climb-in-encouraging-sign-for-big-tech-11588105574?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wasn’t as bad</a> as feared. “People are relying on Google’s services more than ever,” CEO Sundar Pichai said (correctly) this week. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What techlash?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Turns out, a global lockdown is the ideal time to be dominant in fields such as cloud computing, social networks, enterprise software, video, logistics, and delivery. By helping us make the transition to WFH feel less crippling, the U.S.’ largest tech companies have managed to play offense while middling players scramble for their lives.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Another reason Big Tech is riding high: They might've managed to flip the script on regulation. “Me? You want to break me up? The company who can deliver you toilet paper in two days? Who will let you videoconference with 50 friends for free? Who's developing lifesaving health apps? Didn't think so.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reality check: </strong>Antitrust investigations that began in 2019 are still ongoing, and they’ll certainly ramp up as lockdowns ease. If anything, Big Tech flexing its muscles during the pandemic may invite even <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/05/01/facebook-google-amazon-coronavirus-227522?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>more </em>scrutiny</a> from lawmakers. “We can’t stand by and let Amazon, Facebook, Google, and all the rest gobble up all the innovators in our economy,” Sen. Josh Hawley told Politico.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Right on cue, yesterday the House Judiciary Committee asked Jeff Bezos to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/01/house-judiciary-committee-asks-amazon-ceo-jeff-bezos-to-testify-over-allegedly-misleading-congress.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testify</a> over allegations Amazon lied to Congress.</p>

SIZE MATTERS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/companies-make-1-microsoft?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How Big Is Big?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Yao Ming and Gary Player" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MDIveWFvX21pbmdfYW5kX2dhcnlfcGxheWVyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Power Sport Images/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Good question. Use this analogy: Big Tech is to the business world as Yao Ming is to Gary Player...if Yao Ming grew to the size of the Empire State Building.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Microsoft currently has a market capitalization of more than $1.3 trillion. Here's a list of companies whose <em>combined</em> market value is roughly equivalent to 1 Microsoft:</p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>50 Macy's</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>5 Twitters</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>4 Fords</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>3 Boeings</span></li>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>JPMorgan</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>McDonald's</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Goldman Sachs</span></li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GROWTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/areas-big-tech-eyeing-expansion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Road Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If there's anything we know about the tech giants, it's that they're always looking to <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">rip off Snapchat</span> enter new industries. So what's on tap? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Health tech: </strong>Apple and Google are set to launch their joint coronavirus <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/28/apple-iphone-contact-tracing-how-it-came-together.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">contact tracing software</a> on May 1—but their ambitions in the personal health market have been obvious for years. Google's "<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-s-secret-project-nightingale-gathers-personal-health-data-on-millions-of-americans-11573496790?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Project Nightingale</a>" is a massive project parsing the health data of tens of millions of Americans. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And Tim Cook said this </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/01/08/tim-cook-teases-new-apple-services-tied-to-health-care.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">last year</a></span><span>: “If you zoom out into the future, and you look back, and you ask the question, 'What was Apple's greatest contribution to mankind?' It will be about health.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Education:</strong> As more classrooms lean on digital tools, tech giants like <a href="https://www.unicef.org/press-releases/unicef-and-microsoft-launch-global-learning-platform-help-address-covid-19-education?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Microsoft</a> are working on ways to facilitate learning in the most rural communities around the globe. But Google seems likely to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-09/google-widens-lead-in-education-market-as-students-rush-online?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dominate the category</a> during and after the pandemic. Its free Google Classroom service doubled active users to 100+ million from early March to early April.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Videoconferencing: </strong>Following Zoom’s hostile takeover as our virtual bachelorette party platform of choice, Facebook launched Messenger Rooms for more robust <a href="https://www.cnet.com/how-to/messenger-rooms-heres-how-to-use-facebooks-free-new-video-chat-app/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">video chat</a>. Meanwhile, Google made Meet (previously Hangouts Meet) free for all users, and Microsoft is <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/29/21240942/google-meet-free-zoom-response-microsoft-teams-features?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beefing up</a> Teams. They're all adding familiar tile views and, this goes without saying, custom virtual backgrounds. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/coronavirus-impact-startups-reverberates-throughout-silicon-valley?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Tech Loses Its Engine Room
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Cuban angry" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=370 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xT9IgELeO6bNjMHrTW/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Cuban angry" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xT9IgELeO6bNjMHrTW/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Aka startups. Young, ~disruptive~ firms with names like uLamp and PlateSponge have always formed the base layer of tech’s innovation ecosystem.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The story usually goes like this: Company founded by 23-year-old → grows like a weed → folds, goes public, or joins one of the big guys. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But, as <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/01/technology/virus-start-ups-pummeled-layoffs-unwinding.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the NYT writes</a>, the pandemic is “turbocharging Silicon Valley’s natural selection.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>According to the tracker </span><span><a href="http://layoffs.fyi/tracker/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Layoffs.fyi</a></span><span>, 350+ tech startups have laid off more than 34,000 employees since March 11. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Stay-at-home orders were especially hard on startups in wounded sectors like travel and retail. Airbnb, which barely still counts as a startup, has stopped hiring. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And the venture capital firms that fund startups are in <a href="https://www.axios.com/venture-capital-backed-companies-ppp-loans-4514eef3-4821-4626-9120-9973680589a5.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">no position</a> to provide emergency capital. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s not just bad news for the DataCats.ai of the world </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The big incumbents <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/startup-funding-dwindles-due-to-coronavirus-slowdown-11585175702?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">depend on startups</a> to source talent and tech. After all, who better to employ in your AI department than crazy grad students who started a successful AI company? Last year, Tim Cook told CNBC that Apple <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/06/apple-buys-a-company-every-few-weeks-says-ceo-tim-cook.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">buys a company</a> every two or three weeks on average. And Facebook wouldn't be leading the charge in virtual reality without its acquisition of Oculus in 2014. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>That startup pipeline is drying up. Glassdoor Senior Economist Daniel Zhao says the current startup environment is worse than either the 2008 financial crisis or the bursting of the dot-com bubble in the early 2000s. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
NEXT GENERATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/big-tech-20-makes-cut?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
FAMGA 2.0: Who Makes the Cut?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Fortnite parent Epic Games launches publishing label" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzQvZXBpY19nYW1lc19mb3J0bml0ZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Epic Games</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Recessions have a knack of <a href="https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-spins-techs-great-wheel-again-0afefedc-36d1-439f-8c0e-3c416282dadf.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">changing up the guard</a>. So we’re wondering...who could be next in line to join tech’s A-list? </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Pick your squad</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Gaming:</strong></span><span> </span><span><em>Fortnite </em></span><span>maker Epic Games and </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/02/28/roblox-raises-series-g-4b-valuation?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Roblox</a></span><span> are making a strong case as </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/20/travis-scott-embarks-worldwide-concert-tour-inside-fortnite?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">concerts</a></span><span>, </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/12/16/fortnite-star-wars-unveil-ingame-collaboration?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">movie events</a></span><span>, and other economic activity shifts to the virtual realm.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Work: </strong></span><span>CRM do-it-all Salesforce is certainly a giant, but the newly public duo of Slack and Zoom have also proven their value during the pandemic.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Fintech:</strong></span><span> During the PPP chaos, PayPal and Square showed they can be more nimble than Wall Street incumbents. Let's see if they can lead a revolution in payments in the U.S.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tech tech: </strong></span><span>Cloud services and cybersecurity are the unsung heroes of our digital economy. Consider this: A "hybrid cloud" company you never heard of (Red Hat) was bought by IBM last year for $34 billion.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But are they capital-B big tech?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The club is harder to get into than Skull and Bones. Big Tech companies have <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/12/20/10-years-big-tech-diversification?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">muscled</a> their way into ~$1T market caps by spreading far and wide across cloud, AI, enterprise services, wearables, entertainment, news, auto, healthcare...we could keep going.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>one day, the FAMGA (Facebook, Amazon, Microsoft, Google, and Apple) quintet will get disrupted, either by natural industry evolution or by alien invasion. Let's hope for the first one. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We want to hear from you. </strong>Who’s in your 2030 FAMGA?</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">These stocks are coming in hot.</strong> The stock analysts at The Motley Fool have just released three “Double Down” stocks for investors who might have missed the boat on great stock picks. See what stocks are cookin’ up returns <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-dd-3?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-doubledown3&aid=9431&paid=9431&waid=9431&source=esamnbwdg0210075&psource=esamnbwdg0210075&wsource=esamnbwdg0210075" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cutting grass and growing green. </strong>U.S. commercial landscaping is a $53 billion dollar industry, and it’s ripe for disrupting. Meet <a href="https://www.grazemowing.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=maysecond" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Graze</a>, the fully-autonomous commercial lawn mower that you can add to your portfolio. This bad boy already has $36.9mm in conditional pre-orders from the nation’s biggest players—<a href="https://www.grazemowing.com/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=maysecond" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invest today</a>.*</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Remember the techlash?</strong> NYU Prof. Scott Galloway, one of Big Tech's toughest critics, went on our podcast <em>Business Casual</em> last fall to make the case for breaking up the tech giants. <a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/the-breakup-scott-galloway-on-big-tech/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Give it a listen</a> and consider whether anything's changed since.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Weekend Conversation Starters</strong>: for when you're not watching Sunday's stream of <a href="https://www.twitch.tv/fadedspadecards" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Chipping in for COVID</a>...</p>

Amazon and Apple led a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/30/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebroad decline\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for stocks yesterday. That's two straight weekly losses if you're counting at home. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTECH\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/01/big-tech-flexes-muscles-pandemic-antitrust-probes-await?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBig Tech: In the Right Place at the Right Time\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Big Tech as Ghostbusters\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MDEvYmlnX3RlY2hfYXNfZ2hvc3RidXN0ZXJzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt used to be a joke: “Big Tech runs my life.” Now, in the middle of a global pandemic, we can say it without any hint of irony. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNightclubs, gyms, and, well, far too many things have migrated to \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFacebook’s\u003c/strong\u003e Instagram Live.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAmazon\u003c/strong\u003e delivers our essential goods, and...some nonessential goods \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/zipper-mouth-face_1f910.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e. While more than 30 million Americans have filed for unemployment since March, Amazon hired 175,000 new workers—more jobs than it added all of last year.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eQ1 earnings are \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/microsoft-earnings-stock-market-coronavirus-e5e19508-9b34-44a9-9a4a-12d1c3ac606b.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset to fall\u003c/a\u003e by 15.8% (the most in more than a decade), but \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMicrosoft \u003c/strong\u003esaid the coronavirus had “minimal net impact” on its revenue. That marked the first time in history that \"coronavirus\" and “minimal impact” were used in the same sentence. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eScreen time on \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eApple’s\u003c/strong\u003e phones used to indicate isolation and loneliness—now it measures whether we’ve been interacting with people. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGoogle\u003c/strong\u003e was supposed to be dinged by lower ad spend across the board, but...even that \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-revenues-climb-in-encouraging-sign-for-big-tech-11588105574?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewasn’t as bad\u003c/a\u003e as feared. “People are relying on Google’s services more than ever,” CEO Sundar Pichai said (correctly) this week. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat techlash?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTurns out, a global lockdown is the ideal time to be dominant in fields such as cloud computing, social networks, enterprise software, video, logistics, and delivery. By helping us make the transition to WFH feel less crippling, the U.S.’ largest tech companies have managed to play offense while middling players scramble for their lives.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnother reason Big Tech is riding high: They might've managed to flip the script on regulation. “Me? You want to break me up? The company who can deliver you toilet paper in two days? Who will let you videoconference with 50 friends for free? Who's developing lifesaving health apps? Didn't think so.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check: \u003c/strong\u003eAntitrust investigations that began in 2019 are still ongoing, and they’ll certainly ramp up as lockdowns ease. If anything, Big Tech flexing its muscles during the pandemic may invite even \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/05/01/facebook-google-amazon-coronavirus-227522?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003emore \u003c/em\u003escrutiny\u003c/a\u003e from lawmakers. “We can’t stand by and let Amazon, Facebook, Google, and all the rest gobble up all the innovators in our economy,” Sen. Josh Hawley told Politico.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRight on cue, yesterday the House Judiciary Committee asked Jeff Bezos to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/01/house-judiciary-committee-asks-amazon-ceo-jeff-bezos-to-testify-over-allegedly-misleading-congress.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etestify\u003c/a\u003e over allegations Amazon lied to Congress.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F05%2F01%2Fbig-tech-flexes-muscles-pandemic-antitrust-probes-await\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC84MDIveWFvX21pbmdfYW5kX2dhcnlfcGxheWVyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePower Sport Images/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGood question. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf there's anything we know about the tech giants, it's that they're always looking to \u003cspan style=\"text-decoration: line-through;\"\u003erip off Snapchat\u003c/span\u003e enter new industries. So what's on tap? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHealth tech: \u003c/strong\u003eApple and Google are set to launch their joint coronavirus \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/28/apple-iphone-contact-tracing-how-it-came-together.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtact tracing software\u003c/a\u003e on May 1—but their ambitions in the personal health market have been obvious for years. Google's \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-s-secret-project-nightingale-gathers-personal-health-data-on-millions-of-americans-11573496790?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eProject Nightingale\u003c/a\u003e\" is a massive project parsing the health data of tens of millions of Americans. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd Tim Cook said this \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/01/08/tim-cook-teases-new-apple-services-tied-to-health-care.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elast year\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: “If you zoom out into the future, and you look back, and you ask the question, 'What was Apple's greatest contribution to mankind?' It will be about health.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEducation:\u003c/strong\u003e As more classrooms lean on digital tools, tech giants like \u003ca href=\"https://www.unicef.org/press-releases/unicef-and-microsoft-launch-global-learning-platform-help-address-covid-19-education?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMicrosoft\u003c/a\u003e are working on ways to facilitate learning in the most rural communities around the globe. But Google seems likely to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-09/google-widens-lead-in-education-market-as-students-rush-online?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edominate the category\u003c/a\u003e during and after the pandemic. Its free Google Classroom service doubled active users to 100+ million from early March to early April.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVideoconferencing: \u003c/strong\u003eFollowing Zoom’s hostile takeover as our virtual bachelorette party platform of choice, Facebook launched Messenger Rooms for more robust \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/how-to/messenger-rooms-heres-how-to-use-facebooks-free-new-video-chat-app/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evideo chat\u003c/a\u003e. Meanwhile, Google made Meet (previously Hangouts Meet) free for all users, and Microsoft is \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/29/21240942/google-meet-free-zoom-response-microsoft-teams-features?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeefing up\u003c/a\u003e Teams. width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAka startups. Young, ~disruptive~ firms with names like uLamp and PlateSponge have always formed the base layer of tech’s innovation ecosystem.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe story usually goes like this: Company founded by 23-year-old → grows like a weed → folds, goes public, or joins one of the big guys. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut, as \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/01/technology/virus-start-ups-pummeled-layoffs-unwinding.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe NYT writes\u003c/a\u003e, the pandemic is “turbocharging Silicon Valley’s natural selection.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAccording to the tracker \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://layoffs.fyi/tracker/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLayoffs.fyi\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, 350+ tech startups have laid off more than 34,000 employees since March 11. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStay-at-home orders were especially hard on startups in wounded sectors like travel and retail. Airbnb, which barely still counts as a startup, has stopped hiring. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd the venture capital firms that fund startups are in \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/venture-capital-backed-companies-ppp-loans-4514eef3-4821-4626-9120-9973680589a5.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eno position\u003c/a\u003e to provide emergency capital. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s not just bad news for the DataCats.ai of the world \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe big incumbents \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/startup-funding-dwindles-due-to-coronavirus-slowdown-11585175702?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edepend on startups\u003c/a\u003e to source talent and tech. After all, who better to employ in your AI department than crazy grad students who started a successful AI company? Last year, Tim Cook told CNBC that Apple \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/05/06/apple-buys-a-company-every-few-weeks-says-ceo-tim-cook.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuys a company\u003c/a\u003e every two or three weeks on average. And Facebook wouldn't be leading the charge in virtual reality without its acquisition of Oculus in 2014. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThat startup pipeline is drying up. Glassdoor Senior Economist Daniel Zhao says the current startup environment is worse than either the 2008 financial crisis or the bursting of the dot-com bubble in the early 2000s. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePick your squad\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGaming:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eFortnite \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003emaker Epic Games and \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2020/02/28/roblox-raises-series-g-4b-valuation?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRoblox\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e are making a strong case as \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/20/travis-scott-embarks-worldwide-concert-tour-inside-fortnite?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econcerts\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/12/16/fortnite-star-wars-unveil-ingame-collaboration?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emovie events\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and other economic activity shifts to the virtual realm.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWork: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCRM do-it-all Salesforce is certainly a giant, but the newly public duo of Slack and Zoom have also proven their value during the pandemic.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFintech:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e During the PPP chaos, PayPal and Square showed they can be more nimble than Wall Street incumbents. Let's see if they can lead a revolution in payments in the U.S.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTech tech: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCloud services and cybersecurity are the unsung heroes of our digital economy. Consider this: A \"hybrid cloud\" company you never heard of (Red Hat) was bought by IBM last year for $34 billion.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut are they capital-B big tech?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe club is harder to get into than Skull and Bones. Big Tech companies have \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/12/20/10-years-big-tech-diversification?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emuscled\u003c/a\u003e their way into ~$1T market caps by spreading far and wide across cloud, AI, enterprise services, wearables, entertainment, news, auto, healthcare...we could keep going.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eone day, the FAMGA (Facebook, Amazon, Microsoft, Google, and Apple) quintet will get disrupted, either by natural industry evolution or by alien invasion. Let's hope for the first one. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe want to hear from you.
